com.solidfire.core.client

Interface RequestDispatcher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Versionable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpsRequestDispatcher, HttpsRequestDispatcherWithoutSSLVerification

    public interface RequestDispatcher
extends Versionable
    Represents a mechanism for dispatching requests to some server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String dispatchRequest(String input)
      Dispatch an encoded request to the system and await some response.
      int getPort()
      Returns the port associated with the endpoint
      void setConnectionTimeout(int timeInMilliseconds)
      Sets the time to attempt to connect to a cluster.
      void setReadTimeout(int timeInMilliseconds)
      Sets the time to attempt to read data from a request to a cluster.
      void setTimeoutToDefault()
      Sets the time to attempt to connect to a cluster and the time to attempt to read data from a request to a cluster to the default settings.

      • Methods inherited from interface Versionable

        getVersion

    • Method Detail

      • dispatchRequest

        String dispatchRequest(String input)
                throws IOException
        Dispatch an encoded request to the system and await some response.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string to send to the remote server.
        Returns:
        The server's response.
        Throws:
        IOException - if anything went wrong on the connection side of things.

      • setConnectionTimeout

        void setConnectionTimeout(int timeInMilliseconds)
        Sets the time to attempt to connect to a cluster. Default: 15 seconds
        Parameters:
        timeInMilliseconds - an int that specifies the timeout value to be used in milliseconds
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout parameter is negative

      • setReadTimeout

        void setReadTimeout(int timeInMilliseconds)
        Sets the time to attempt to read data from a request to a cluster. Default: 60 seconds
        Parameters:
        timeInMilliseconds - an int that specifies the timeout value to be used in milliseconds
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout parameter is negative

      • setTimeoutToDefault

        void setTimeoutToDefault()
        Sets the time to attempt to connect to a cluster and the time to attempt to read data from a request to a cluster to the default settings. Connection Default: 15 seconds Read Default: 60 seconds

      • getPort

        int getPort()
        Returns the port associated with the endpoint
        Returns:
        port as int
